    • handleConnection

      protected abstract void handleConnection(Socket sock) throws IOException
      Callback used to handle a connection call. After returning from this call, the socket is closed. Use stopAcceptingConnections() to stop accepting new calls.
      Parameters:
      sock - The socket to handle.
      Throws:
      IOException - upon error.

    • stopAcceptingConnections

      protected void stopAcceptingConnections()
      Called from within handleConnection(Socket) to tell the server to no longer accept new calls and to terminate the server thread. Note that this will lead to existing client connections to be closed. If you want to deny new connections but finish your work on the client side (in another thread), then please use semaphores etc. to ensure reaching a safe state before calling this method.

    • handleException

      protected SocketTestBase.ExceptionHandlingDecision handleException(Exception e)
      Called upon receiving an exception that may be handled specifically.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception
      Returns:
      SocketTestBase.ExceptionHandlingDecision.RAISE if we should handle the exception somehow, SocketTestBase.ExceptionHandlingDecision.IGNORE if we should pretend the exception never occurred.

    • checkException

      public void checkException() throws Exception
      Checks if there were any exceptions thrown during the lifetime of this ServerThread. NOTE: This call blocks until the Thread actually terminates.
      Throws:
      Exception - upon error.
